alert.note: Alert for Knox (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:56AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Knox County through 545 AM CDT... At 456 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Henderson, or 12 miles northwest of Galesburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rio around 505 AM CDT. Wataga and Oneida around 515 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Altona and Victoria. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 34 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
